text: the recipe is a Clementine clafouti now
what's a clafouti well if you think of a
pancake with fruit in it a clafouti is
kind of the opposite it's fruit with
pancake batter around it it sounds
French
you can call it a freedom pancake if you
don't like the term clafouti it is
French it sounds hard it's actually
quite easy I think it's probably the
fastest fancy dessert you can possibly
make start with some eggs a pinch of
salt a little whisking you can go either
of two directions here you can beat in
the dry ingredients and then add more
wet or you can do what I'm about to do
which is combine all the wet ingredients
that's cream
that's milk and generally in any pancake
batter you want about the same amount of
solids and liquids so we've got a cup
and a half of cream and milk together
plus a little egg we've got close to two
cups of that and we're gonna add close
to three cups of flour and sugar so
sugar and this is dessert so it's gonna
be sweet this is a little thinner than a
typical pancake batter instead of having
say a cup of flour to a cup of milk it's
got cup and a half of liquid plus the
eggs and just a cup of sugar and flour
mix together so once that's all blended
sugars in there you very quickly beat in
the flour you don't want to toughen this
at all and not beat any more than is
necessary you can see there's some lumps
here that's fine they will cook out you
can layer your mandarin oranges quite
beautifully like that or you can do this
and then your batter on top so you're
gonna bake this at 350 for something
between 30 and 45 minutes you'll know
when it's done because the top is gonna
be beautifully browned but here we go at
350 degrees let's say a half an hour
when it's done beautifully browned how
golden it is so pretty
you want to let it rest for 15 minutes a
half hour even an hour is fine
so I'm gonna cut myself a piece
the nice custardy texture like I said
flute with pancake batter whoa come back
I forgot little powdered sugar
completely and totally unnecessary but
look how nice it looks
okay now we're really done
